service.provider

Interface ServiceProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MessagingServiceProvider

    public interface ServiceProvider
    This interface should be implemented by the classes that are interested to provide communication mechanism between different services.
    Author:
    M. Usman Iftikhar, Yifan Ruan

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void sendMessage(java.lang.String msgText, java.lang.String destinationEndPoint)
      With this method, a service can send a message to the other service.
      void startListening(java.lang.String endPoint, MessageReceiver messageReceiver)
      This method enables a service to listen for messages on the given endpoint.
      void stopListening()
      This method stops a service for listening to the incoming messages.

    • Method Detail

      • startListening

        void startListening(java.lang.String endPoint,
                    MessageReceiver messageReceiver)
        This method enables a service to listen for messages on the given endpoint.
        Parameters:
        endPoint - which endpoint to be listened
        messageReceiver - instance for dealing with incoming messages

      • stopListening

        void stopListening()
        This method stops a service for listening to the incoming messages.

      • sendMessage

        void sendMessage(java.lang.String msgText,
                 java.lang.String destinationEndPoint)
        With this method, a service can send a message to the other service.
        Parameters:
        msgText - the message content
        destinationEndPoint - the destination to send the message
